results.name: Write n in binary, then increase each run of 1's by one 1. a(n) is the decimal equivalent of the result.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 12 in binary is 1100. Increase each run of 1 by one digit to get 11100, which is 28 in decimal. So a(12) = 28.
mathematica: Table[FromDigits[Flatten[If[MemberQ[#,1],Join[{1},#],#]&/@ Split[ IntegerDigits[ n,2]]],2],{n,60}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Oct 10 2013 *)
